name: Bert Baumgaertner
topic: Writing a complete open text on Decision Theory.

name: Helen Brown
course: MVSC 486 and MVSC 586- Healthy Active Lifestyles Assessment and Program Planning
topic: Creating an interactive workbook to support student progress over the semester.

name: Janine Darragh
course: OER for outreach, service, and research in conjunction with English teachers from crisis contexts around the world.
topic: Create fresh OER entries on OERCommons to transition content from a locked in app to a more accessible format.

name: Lauren McCleary
topic: Creating a zero cost syllabus for a high-enrollment Introduction to Art Course - Art 101.

name: Matthew (Matt) Grindal
course: CRIM 101: Introduction to Criminology and CRIM 420: Substance Use and Society
topic: Develop course readers that support these two courses utilizing existing open texts.

name: Russell (Russ) Meeuf
topic: Building a zero cost or very low cost film studies course that still utilizes contemporary and exciting titles for students.

name: Helen Brown
course: MVSC 486/586- Healthy Active Lifestyles Assessment and Intervention
topic: Dr. Brown will create an open source workbook to support students in developing their skills to develop and implement public health promotion projects.

name: Janine Darragh
course: EDCI 448/548: Introduction to ENL in the K-12 Schools
topic: Dr. Darragh will create an open syllabus that transitions EDCI 448/548 from a traditional text to a no-cost syllabus using open materials and course reserves resources.

name: Leontina Hormel
course: WGSS 201: Introduction to Women's, Gender and Sexuality Studies
topic: Dr. Hormel will adapt an open textbook for WGSS 201, Intro to Women's, Gender and Sexuality Studies and will create an accompanying open syllabus.

name: Sarah Bush
topic: Dr. Bush will create and adapt open materials to replace traditional texts in AgED251.

name: R. A. Borrelli
topic: Dr. Borrelli will continue development of an OER for fundamental nuclear engineering knowledge.

name: Rebekka Boysen-Taylor
topic: Boysen-Taylor will develop materials that support creating open assignments for elementary educators.

name: Vanessa Anthony-Stevens
topic: Dr. Anthony-Stevens will develop a resource tentatively title Honoring Indigenous Histories: A Reader for Teachers. This resource will offer an overview of Indigenous Histories in the US, foundations of tribal sovereignty and constructive advice on ways for teachers to respect and engage with Indigenous communities in their praxis. This title will place a special focus on Indigenous communities of the Greater Pacific Northwest.

name: Katie Blevins
course: JAMM 458: Public Relations Research and Case Studies
topic: Dr. Blevins will identify and create OER to support JAMM458, a Public Relations research-based course. Her efforts will focus on adapting existing open materials, as well as identifying openly licensed studies, and alternatives to costly traditional case studies.

name: Xiao Hu
topic: Dr.Hu will identify and create OER, as well as Library resources, to replace multiple textbooks for ARCH 458, Urban Theory and Issues, and two study abroad courses in China. Dr.Hu hopes to alleviate costs for students, while also reducing the number of textbooks scholars must bring on study-abroad trips.

name: Ashley Kerr
course: SPAN/LAS 306: Culture and Institutions of Latin America
impact-tags: College Assistance Migrant Program (CAMP); U of I; Regional; National
topic: Dr. Kerr will develop a collection of openly licenses materials (OER) to create a culturally responsive reader for Spanish 306 Culture and Institutions of Latin America, which covers pre-Colombian to current Latin American History. This reader will include culturally responsive and engaged content to better serve the diverse backgrounds of our UI students.

name: Rebekka Boysen-Taylor
course: EDCI 328 Elementary Social Studies Methods, EDCI 302 Teaching Culturally Diverse Learners, EDCI 432 Secondary Social Studies Methods Course,
impact-tags: U of I; Regional; Idaho public schools
topic: Working in close collaboration with the Frederick Douglass Family Foundation, Boysen-Taylor will create a series of “rehistory-ing” lesson plans centered on the life of Anna Murray Douglass, the wife of Frederick Douglass and a formidable civil rights champion in her own right.

name: Kathryn Pawelko
topic: Pawelko’s work will focus on creating culturally responsive course syllabi and lesson plans for English 101 and 102 at the University of Idaho. These materials will include relevant information on English as a second language praxis, as well as content and materials selected to better engage with students of diverse backgrounds and identities.

name: Judith Terrio
course: MATH 123 Mathematics Applied to the Modern World

name: Shenghan Xu
course: OM 370/470 Process Management / Supply Chain Management
